result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Henry Ronne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Civil Arrest/Body Execution, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Sentence to commence forthwith.  Huber granted.  Granted Good Time.  May transfer to Columbia County.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
*Bond on file to be applied and any balance returned

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Henry Ronne

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
(copied MASO)

11:04 AM Defendant Ryan Henry Ronne in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp in court for Ryan Henry Ronne.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 2. Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Klopp agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Court orders 5 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Forthwith
Credit = 39 days
Good Time
May transfer to Columbia County
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $200.00
Cash bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it

Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in
